input.description: The input file or URL to the OpenAPI 3 specification, JSON or YAML, local file or URL

output.description: Where generated files will be written to. Defaults to 'src/app/api'.

fetchTimeout.description: Indicates the timeout when fetching the input URL, in milliseconds. Defaults to 20 seconds (20000).

defaultTag.description: Tag name assumed for operations without tags. Defaults to 'Api'.

includeTags.description: When specified, filters the generated services, including only those corresponding to this list of tags.

excludeTags.description: When specified, filters the generated services, excluding any service corresponding to this list of tags.

ignoreUnusedModels.description: Indicates whether or not to ignore model files that are not referenced by any operation. Defaults to true.

removeStaleFiles.description: Indicates whether or not to remove any files in the output folder that were not generated. Defaults to true.

modelIndex.description: Typescript file, without '.ts' extension that exports all models. Set to false to skip. Defaults to `models`.

functionIndex.description: Typescript file, without '.ts' extension that exports all functions. Set to false to skip. Defaults to `functions`.

services.description: When set to false, no services will be generated, only operation functions. Disabling services also disables the module and service index.

serviceIndex.description: Typescript file, without '.ts' extension that exports all services. Set to false to skip. Defaults to `services`.

servicePrefix.description: Prefix for generated service classes. Defaults to empty.

serviceSuffix.description: Suffix for generated service classes. Defaults to `Service`.

modelPrefix.description: Prefix for generated model classes. Defaults to empty.

modelSuffix.description: Suffix for generated model classes. Defaults to empty.

configuration.description: Name for the configuration class to generate. Defaults to 'ApiConfiguration'.

baseService.description: Name for the base service class to generate. Defaults to 'BaseService'.

apiService.description: Name for the service to call functions directly. By default is not generated.

requestBuilder.description: Name for the request builder class to generate. Defaults to 'RequestBuilder'.

response.description: Name for the response class to generate. Defaults to 'StrictHttpResponse'.

module.description: Class name of the module that provides all services. Set to false to skip. Defaults to `ApiModule`.

enumArray.description: Should an array be exported for each model, in a file sibling to the enum definition?

endOfLineStyle.description: Determines how to normalize line endings. Possible values are: `crlf`: normalize line endings to CRLF (Windows, DOS) => \r\n. `lf` normalize line endings to LF (Unix, OS X) => \n. `cr` normalize line endings to CR (Mac OS) => \r. `auto` normalize line endings for the current operating system. Defaults to 'auto'.

templates.description: Custom templates directory. Any `.handlebars` files here will be used instead of the corresponding default.

excludeParameters.description: When specified, ignores on generated services any parameters whose names are in this list.

indexFile.description: When set to true, a index.ts file will be generated that exports all generated files.

skipJsonSuffix.description: When specified, does not generate a $Json suffix.

customizedResponseType.description: Defines which paths to use which responseType, commonly used when build-in deduction can't fullfill your needs

useTempDir.description: When specified, will create temporary files in system temporary folder instead of output folder

silent.description: When set to true, no verbose output will be displayed.

camelizeModelNames.description: When true (default) models names will be camelized, besides having the first letter capitalized. Setting to false will prevent camelizing.

keepFullResponseMediaType.description:
When true, the expected response type in the request method names are not abbreviated and all response variants are kept.
When array is given, `mediaType` is expected to be a RegExp string matching the response media type. The first match in the array
will decide whether or how to shorten the media type. If no mediaType is given, it will always match.
'short':     application/x-spring-data-compact+json    ->    getEntities$Json
'tail':      application/x-spring-data-compact+json    ->    getEntities$XSpringDataCompactJson
'full':      application/x-spring-data-compact+json    ->    getEntities$ApplicationXSpringDataCompactJson
